title: Fetch & Process Results
text: fetching data, ensure authenticated. stored keys (see Getting Started), automatic.
code: # Authenticate using stored credentials formr_api_authenticate(host = "https://api.formr.org") # or your custom URL!

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: primary function formr_api_results(). default, performs “Smart Fetch” handles everything download psychometric scoring.
code: # Fetch, reverse, aggregate, and join all data df <- formr_api_results(run_name = "daily_diary")

what: What does formr_api_results do by default?
title: Fetch & Process Results
text: Downloads results metadata surveys run. Recognises data types (converts “2023-01-01” Dates, JSON arrays lists, etc.). Reverses items ending R (e.g., neuro_3R) based item choices. Aggregates scales (calculates means items shared stem). Joins surveys single “wide” format (one row per session).

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: can toggle behaviors using arguments want raw data need handle processing manually:
code: # Get processed data, but strictly separated by survey (no join) list_of_dfs <- formr_api_results("daily_diary", join = FALSE)  # Get raw data (types recognized, but NO reversing or scoring) raw_data <- formr_api_results("daily_diary", compute_scales = FALSE)

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: used compute_scales = FALSE , debugging specific scale isn’t calculating correctly, can use lower-level processing functions manually. rely survey’s metadata (item table).

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: Processing requires knowing items numeric, reversed (e.g., ends R), scale options .
code: # Fetch the run structure (contains all item metadata) metadata <- formr_api_run_structure("daily_diary")

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: function automatically reverses items end R (e.g., bfi_neuro_3R). uses item’s defined choices (e.g., 1 5) calculate reversal correctly: New=(Max+Min)−OldNew = (Max + Min) - Old. Result: column bfi_neuro_3R now contains reversed values. attribute reversed = TRUE added column tracking.
code: # Apply reverse coding to raw results df_reversed <- formr_api_reverse(results = raw_data, item_list = metadata)

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: function calculates mean scores items sharing common “stem”. example, extra_1, extra_2, extra_3R, function detects stem extra, calculates row-mean, creates new column extra. Result: new column extra added dataframe containing mean items.
code: # Calculate scales (means) df_scored <- formr_api_aggregate(results = df_reversed, item_list = metadata)

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: complete, reproducible snippet typical analysis script. Note formr_api_results simplifies process significantly compared older versions package.
code: library(formr) library(dplyr)  # 1. Connect formr_api_authenticate(host = "https://api.formr.org") # or your custom URL!  # 2. Get Processed Data (Reversed & Scored) run_name <- "daily_diary" data <- formr_api_results(run_name)  # 3. Analyze summary(clean_data$bfi_neuro) # This scale was computed automatically! # ...

title: Fetch & Process Results
text: Ensure variable names follow stem_number stem_numberR convention (e.g., neuro_1, neuro_2R). formr_api_aggregate (thus formr_api_results) relies group items.

title: Getting Started
text: use API features (fetching results, managing files), must first authenticate.

title: Getting Started
text: can store credentials securely system’s keyring don’t type every time.

title: Getting Started
text: Log formr.org (instance). Go Account > API Settings. Create Client ID Secret. Run following code R console:
code: # Store your credentials once # This saves them securely in your OS credential store formr_store_keys(   host = "https://api.formr.org",    client_id = "YOUR_CLIENT_ID",    client_secret = "YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET" )

title: Getting Started
text: plan use “Classic” functions (e.g. formr_results(), formr_raw_results()), need store email password. allows create shorthand name account log securely without putting passwords script. Run following code R console. prompted enter email password (optionally 2FA secret) securely.
code: # Store your email/password under a shorthand name (e.g. "main_account") formr_store_keys("main_account")

title: Getting Started
text: keys stored, simply authenticate start session:

title: Getting Started
code: # Automatically finds your stored keys formr_api_authenticate(host = "https://api.formr.org") # or your custom URL!

title: Getting Started
text: stored, can connect scripts using shorthand:
code: # Connect using the stored credentials formr_connect("main_account")

title: Manage your Files
text: see files currently attached run, use formr_api_files(). returns data frame containing file names, public URLs, upload timestamps. returned url column particularly useful need embed assets external emails websites.
code: # List all files attached to the study files <- formr_api_files("my-study-name")  # View the first few files head(files)

title: Manage your Files
text: can upload files individually bulk. useful quickly patching missing image adding new stimulus without re-syncing entire project.

title: Manage your Files
code: # Upload a single logo formr_api_upload_file("my-study-name", path = "assets/logo.png")

title: Manage your Files
text: function flexible: can pass vector paths directory. pass directory, formr upload files directly inside .
code: # Upload multiple specific files formr_api_upload_file("my-study-name", path = c("assets/img1.jpg", "assets/img2.jpg"))  # Upload an entire folder of stimuli formr_api_upload_file("my-study-name", path = "assets/stimuli/")

title: Manage your Files
text: keep run clean, can remove obsolete files.
code: # Delete a specific file formr_api_delete_file("my-study-name", file_name = "old_logo.png")  # Delete a list of files formr_api_delete_file("my-study-name", file_name = c("test1.jpg", "test2.jpg"))

title: Manage your Files
text: restructuring study want start fresh, can wipe files. Use caution.

title: Manage your Projects
text: Ensure stored API credentials described Getting Started guide.
code: # Automatically finds your stored keys formr_api_authenticate(host = "https://api.formr.org") # or your custom URL!

title: Manage your Projects
text: making major changes, good practice create full backup run. function downloads run structure (JSON), survey item tables (Excel), attached files (images/scripts), current results. creates self-contained archive study state moment.
code: # Download everything to a folder named "backup_my_study" formr_api_backup_run("my-study-name", dir = "backup_my_study")

title: Manage your Projects
text: recommended workflow active development Pull -> Edit -> Push.

title: Manage your Projects
text: First, create local directory project pull current state server. scaffolds necessary folder structure. create following structure: surveys/: Contains survey spreadsheets (.xlsx). files/: Contains images assets. css/ & js/: Contains custom styling scripts. run_settings.json: Configuration like privacy settings data expiration. run_structure.json: flow run (surveys, pauses, emails).
code: # Pull the project into a local folder formr_api_pull_project("my-study-name", dir = "my_project_folder")

title: Manage your Projects
text: can now edit files using favorite tools: Open .xlsx files Excel/LibreOffice. Edit .css .js VS Code RStudio. Add new images files/ folder.

title: Manage your Projects
text: happy local changes, push back server. function compares file modification times uploads changed.
code: # Sync local changes to the server formr_api_push_project("my-study-name", dir = "my_project_folder")

title: Manage your Projects
text: heavily editing survey, running formr_push_project manually every time can tedious. can use watch argument keep connection open. package monitor folder upload changes immediately save files. Note run commands stop watcher pressing “Esc”-Key.
code: # Automatically push changes when files are saved (Press Esc to stop) formr_api_push_project("my-study-name", dir = "my_project_folder", watch = TRUE)

title: Manage your Projects
text: can also view update run settings programmatically. useful toggling specific flags like public locked without navigating UI.
code: # View current settings settings <- formr_api_run_settings("my-study-name") print(settings)  # Update specific settings formr_api_run_settings("my-study-name", settings = list(   public = 2,        # Make run accessible via Link   locked = TRUE      # Lock run   # ... ))

title: Manage your Projects
text: advanced users, entire flow run (“Unit” list) can exported imported JSON. allows template complex study designs import directly.
code: # Export structure to a file formr_api_run_structure("my-study-name", file = "structure.json")  # Import structure from a file (Replaces current structure!) formr_api_run_structure("my-study-name", structure_json_path = "structure.json")

title: Manage your Runs
text: see overview studies access , use formr_api_runs(). returns tidy data frame containing run ID, name, status flags (whether public, locked, active cron jobs).
code: # List all runs and their status runs <- formr_api_runs()  # Quickly check which runs are currently active/public subset(runs, public == TRUE)

title: Manage your Runs
text: can create new, empty run directly R. useful setting battery studies programmatically. function returns public link new run upon success.
code: # Create a new run named "pilot-study-v1" formr_api_create_run("pilot-study-v1")

title: Manage your Runs
text: run exists, often need toggle settings—example, locking prevent accidental edits data collection making public participants. formr_api_run_settings() function handles . GET: provide run name, returns current settings. PATCH: provide settings list, updates run.
code: # 1. View current settings settings <- formr_api_run_settings("pilot-study-v1")  # 2. Update settings: Lock the run and make it public formr_api_run_settings("pilot-study-v1", settings = list(   locked = TRUE,     # Prevent structure changes   public = 2,      # Allow participants to access via Link   expiresOn = "2026-12-31"    # Set Data Expiration Date (required to make your Run public) ))

title: Manage your Runs
text: “Structure” run ordered list units (surveys, emails, pauses, jumps) determines participant’s path. can export structure JSON safekeeping import replicate study design.

title: Manage your Runs
text: can inspect structure R list save directly JSON file create 1:1 backup runs configuration.
code: # Inspect structure in R struct <- formr_api_run_structure("pilot-study-v1") print(struct)  # Save to file (Backup) formr_api_run_structure("pilot-study-v1", file = "pilot_v1_structure.json")

title: Manage your Runs
text: can upload JSON file replace current run structure. useful creating templates: can define complex flow apply multiple runs. part JSON file, also create necessary surveys run.
code: # Overwrite the run's structure with a local JSON file formr_api_run_structure("pilot-study-v1", structure_json_path = "pilot_v1_structure.json")

title: Manage your Runs
text: can permanently delete run created mistake longer needed. Warning: remove everything associated run, including structure, attached files, collected results. However, surveys used run kept.
code: # Delete a run (prompts for confirmation by default) formr_api_delete_run("pilot-study-v1")  # Force delete without confirmation (for automated scripts) formr_api_delete_run("pilot-study-v1", prompt = FALSE)

title: Manage your Sessions
text: get overview currently study, use formr_api_sessions(). function returns tidy data frame containing session codes, current position run, timestamps.

title: Manage your Sessions
text: can filter sessions see currently active marked test sessions.
code: # List all active sessions (participants currently in the study) active_users <- formr_api_sessions("my-run-name", active = TRUE)  # List all test sessions (e.g., generated by you) test_users <- formr_api_sessions("my-run-name", testing = TRUE)

title: Manage your Sessions
text: know participant’s session code (e.g., user report), can fetch details directly see exactly .
code: # Inspect a specific user user_status <- formr_api_sessions("my-run-name", session_codes = "USER_CODE_123") dplyr::glimpse(user_status)

title: Manage your Sessions
text: users typically create sessions clicking link, might need generate sessions programmatically. common : Laboratory Studies: Pre-generating codes hand participants. Automated Testing: Creating dummy users test study flow.
code: # Create a random session code for testing new_sessions <- formr_api_create_session("my-run-name", testing = TRUE)  # Create a session with a specific code (e.g., for a specific ID) # Please be sure that your session codes are in an allowed format on your server. formr_api_create_session("my-run-name", codes = c("LAB_001", "LAB_002"))

title: Manage your Sessions
text: Sometimes need intervene participant’s progress. formr_api_session_action() function allows modify state one sessions.

what: Use Case 1: Unstucking a User (Move Position)
title: Manage your Sessions
text: bug logic error causes user get stuck specific point, can manually move different unit run.
code: # Move user to position 10 (e.g., the next survey) formr_api_session_action("my-run-name",                       session_codes = "STUCK_USER_CODE",                       action = "move_to_position",                       position = 10)

title: Manage your Sessions
text: accidentally performed self-test “real” session code, real participant used test code, can toggle testing flag. helps keep data clean/separate.
code: # Mark a real session as a test session formr_api_session_action("my-run-name",                       session_codes = "REAL_USER_CODE",                       action = "toggle_testing")

title: Manage your Sessions
text: want manually finish external module session, can “end_external” action.
code: # End a session formr_api_session_action("my-run-name",                       session_codes = "WITHDRAWN_USER_Code",                       action = "end_external")

title: Manage your Surveys
text: view list surveys associated account, use formr_api_surveys(). returns tidy data frame containing survey ID, name, modification timestamps. can also filter list name using name_pattern argument.
code: # List all surveys all_surveys <- formr_api_surveys()  # Find specific surveys (e.g., all diaries) diaries <- formr_api_surveys(name_pattern = "diary") print(diaries)

title: Manage your Surveys
text: can retrieve content survey two ways: data frame (tibble) inspection R, downloadable Excel file (XLSX).

title: Manage your Surveys
text: useful quickly checking variable names, item types, choice labels without leaving R session.
code: # Get the survey items as a tibble items <- formr_api_survey_structure("daily_diary_v1")  # Check the first few items head(items)

title: Manage your Surveys
text: lost local copy survey want backup version currently server, can download directly.
code: # Download the survey as an Excel file formr_api_survey_structure(   survey_name = "daily_diary_v1",    format = "xlsx",    file_path = "backup_daily_diary.xlsx" )

title: Manage your Surveys
text: can upload single survey file directly. useful want update just one component study without syncing entire project folder.
code: # Upload a local Excel file formr_api_upload_survey(   file_path = "surveys/my_new_survey.xlsx",    survey_name = "my_new_survey" # Optional: Defaults to filename if omitted )

title: Manage your Surveys
text: can also import survey directly published Google Sheet URL.

title: Manage your Surveys
text: can permanently delete survey longer needed.
code: # Delete a survey (prompts for confirmation by default) formr_api_delete_survey("old_pilot_survey")  # Force delete without confirmation (for automated scripts) formr_api_delete_survey("old_pilot_survey", prompt = FALSE)

what: The accompanying R package for the study framework formr
title: formr survey framework accompanying R package
text: formr R package serves bridge formr.org survey framework R environment. package pre-loaded server handle survey logic, also provides suite tools local R workflow. used locally (External Usage): functions streamline administration analysis study. Data Management: Connect API fetch, type-cast, automatically score results single step. Project Syncing: Download study structure (surveys, CSS, assets) computer local editing version control, push changes back server. used within run (Internal Usage): functions designed run inside formr.org via OpenCPU enhance participant experience. Dynamic Feedback: Generate immediate, personalized charts visualizations show participants results. Survey Logic: Use shorthand functions handle complex text logic conditional display settings within survey units. can get started right !

title: knit_child as is — asis_knit_child
text: default calling environment? Typically function defaults global environment. makes sense want use knit_children context rest document. However, may also want use knit_children inside functions e.g. summarise regression using set commands (e.g. plot diagnostic graphs summary regression nicely formatted). caveats: function return top-level. way cat() loops -condition without without setting results='asis'. can however concatenate objects paste.knit_asis()

title: knit_child as is — asis_knit_child
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # an example of a wrapper function that calls asis_knit_child with an argument # ensures distinct paths for cache and figures, so that these calls can be looped in parallel regression_summary = function(model) {    child_hash = digest::digest(model)    options = list(        fig.path = paste0(knitr::opts_chunk$get("fig.path"), child_hash, "-"),         cache.path = paste0(knitr::opts_chunk$get("cache.path"), child_hash, "-"))    asis_knit_child("_regression_summary.Rmd", options = options) } } # }

title: Store Credentials in Keyring — formr_store_keys

title: Store Credentials in Keyring — formr_store_keys
code: formr_store_keys(   account_name = NULL,   email = NULL,   password = NULL,   secret_2fa = NULL,   host = "https://formr.org",   client_id = NULL,   client_secret = NULL,   access_token = NULL )

title: Store Credentials in Keyring — formr_store_keys
text: account_name (Legacy) shorthand name account. provided, Legacy mode triggered. email (Legacy) Email address account. prompted omitted. password (Legacy) Optional. Provide skip interactive prompt (useful scripts/tests). secret_2fa (Legacy) 2FA secret. Set NULL prompted, "" used. host (API) API URL (e.g., https://formr.org). Defaults formr.org. client_id (API) OAuth Client ID. client_secret (API) OAuth Client Secret. access_token (API) Direct Personal Access Token (alternative OAuth).

title: Store Credentials in Keyring — formr_store_keys
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # --- LEGACY EXAMPLES --- # Prompts for password interactively formr_store_keys("formr_diary_study_account")  # --- NEW API EXAMPLES --- # Store Personal Access Token formr_store_keys(access_token = "your-token-here")  # Store OAuth Credentials for a custom host formr_store_keys(host = "http://localhost",                  client_id = "my-id",                  client_secret = "my-secret") } # }
